GEO BON with its scientific partners introduced in 2015 a new generation of global indicators integrating biodiversity observations (see [here](https://www.geobon.org/downloads/biodiversity-monitoring/technical-reports/GEOBON/2015/GBCI-Version1.2-low.pdf)), remote sensing data, and models for assessing progress towards the CBD Strategic Plan. In 2020, the GEO BON network developed a [document](https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/60fe/c885/c309aa2a521eb0fec8f892c4/sbstta-24-item3-geobon-technical-support-en.pdf) to support the effective monitoring of goals and targets for the pots-2020 biodiversity framework. The following table summarizes some of the indicators which are in different stages of development and implementation.

For the ecosystem services component we rely on a recent publication from the Ecosystem Services team (see [Balvanera et al 2022](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1877343522000045?fr=RR-2&ref=pdf_download&rr=7c54f0ee4f89c3a5)).
